DOC.brief_summary: Objective : - To define reference-population healthy young men ( 20-29 year old ) . - To establish reference-intervals : 1 . Total , bioavailable free serum androgen ( testosterone , dihydrotestosterone , androstenedione ) serum estrogen ( estradiol , estrone ) . 2 . Total free IGF-1 . - To study influence physical activity , alcohol intake , tobacco abuse anabolic steroid serum level androgen . - To identify androgen ( estrogen ) primarily reflect follow parameter : 1 . Muscle mass , muscle strength , muscle power , oxygen uptake , hematocrit . 2 . Bone mineral density bone metabolism . 3 . Total visceral fat mass . 4 . Lipid- glucose metabolism glucocorticoid metabolism . 5 . Sexual function quality life . - To study modify effect birth weight , AR gene CAG-repeat polymorphism , level IGF-1 association serum androgens measure : Ethics , design schedule : The local ethic review board approve population-based , cross-sectional study plan inclusion 800 Caucasian men , 20 29 year old , living County Funen . The exclusion criterion opioid drug addiction , cancer , severe chronic disease . A basic questionnaire mail 3000 men , randomly draw Danish Central Personal Registry . Adequately answered questionnaire return 2,199 men , subsequently receive invitation participate . Informed consent obtain 783 men . The examination start March 2002 terminate May 2003 . Within subject variation determine study parameter 20 men . The men include match men answer questionnaire questionnaire item demographic . All analysis perform , except additional serum sex hormone assay , IGF-1 assay AR gene analysis . A sequential rule-out reference population perform follow criterion : 1. testicular pathology : bilateral cryptorchidism , varicocele , testes volumina < 10 ml ( ) , history spermatic cord torsion . 2. severe chronic disease . 3. regular medication abuse anabolic steroid . 4. body mass index < 19 kg/m2 . 5. safety serum parameter : luteinizing hormone ( LH ) < 1.0 U/L > 8.4 U/l , alanine-amino-transferase ( ALAT ) > 70 U/l thyrotropin ( TSH ) > 6.0 mU/l .
